Set up monitoring and logging for your M: Set up monitoring and logging for your MBC CQRS Serverless application.
This guide covers setting up comprehensi: This guide covers setting up comprehensive monitoring and logging for MBC CQRS Serverless applications on AWS.
The MBC CQRS Serverless framework provid: The MBC CQRS Serverless framework provides the following observability features out-of-the-box:
Extended NestJS logger with context (ten: Extended NestJS logger with context (tenantCode, userId, requestId, sourceIp)
Enabled by default in the CDK template f: Enabled by default in the CDK template for Lambda and Step Functions
Lambda functions log in JSON format for: Lambda functions log in JSON format for easy querying
The sections below provide guidance on s: The sections below provide guidance on setting up additional AWS CloudWatch features (metrics, dashboards, alarms). These are not built into the framework but are recommended patterns for production deployments.
The framework includes a built-in Reques: The framework includes a built-in RequestLogger that automatically adds context to your logs:
The framework's RequestLogger is used au: The framework's RequestLogger is used automatically
Log output includes: context, requestId,: Log output includes: context, requestId, ip, tenantCode, userId
These logs automatically include user co: These logs automatically include user context in Lambda
You can enhance with structured logging: You can enhance with structured logging for more detailed tracking:
Recommended log format for easy querying: Recommended log format for easy querying:
Custom metrics are not built into the fr: Custom metrics are not built into the framework. The following examples show how you can implement custom metrics in your application using the AWS SDK.
Publish custom metrics from your applica: Publish custom metrics from your application:
Dashboards are not included in the defau: Dashboards are not included in the default CDK template. Add the following to your CDK stack to create a CloudWatch dashboard.
Alarms are not included in the default C: Alarms are not included in the default CDK template. Add the following to your CDK stack for production monitoring.
Set up alarms for critical metrics:: Set up alarms for critical metrics:
X-Ray tracing is enabled by default in t: X-Ray tracing is enabled by default in the MBC CQRS Serverless CDK template for Lambda functions and Step Functions.
X-Ray tracing is already enabled in the: X-Ray tracing is already enabled in the default CDK template:
For deeper tracing of AWS SDK calls and: For deeper tracing of AWS SDK calls and HTTP requests, you can optionally add the aws-xray-sdk package to your application.
Centralized logging is not included in t: Centralized logging is not included in the default template. The following patterns show how to aggregate logs for complex applications.
The framework does not include built-in: The framework does not include built-in APM features. The following examples show patterns you can implement in your application.
The framework provides a basic health ch: The framework provides a basic health check endpoint at `GET /` that returns a simple response. For production applications, you may want to implement more comprehensive health checks:
The default `GET /` endpoint returns \"H: The default `GET /` endpoint returns "Hello World!" and can be used for basic liveness checks.
For more detailed health checks, impleme: For more detailed health checks, implement a custom controller:
Use percentiles (p50, p95, p99) for late: Use percentiles (p50, p95, p99) for latency
